content.question:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

Age (years)
 Frequency

<math alttext="20 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 30"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="160"><mstyle><mrow><mn>160</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="30 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 40"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="130"><mstyle><mrow><mn>130</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="40 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 50"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="50 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 60"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="115"><mstyle><mrow><mn>115</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="60 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 70"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>70</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="125"><mstyle><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="70 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 80"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>70</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="135"><mstyle><mrow><mn>135</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The manager of a vacation resort believes that the ages of adult visitors to the resort can be modeled by a normal distribution. The manager surveyed a random sample of <math alttext="765"><mstyle><mrow><mn>765</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> visitors and recorded their age. A summary of the responses is shown in the frequency table, where <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the age of the visitor.

(a) Construct a histogram of the distribution of ages.

Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

Age (years)
 Frequency

<math alttext="20 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 30"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="160"><mstyle><mrow><mn>160</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="30 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 40"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="130"><mstyle><mrow><mn>130</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="40 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 50"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="100"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="50 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 60"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="115"><mstyle><mrow><mn>115</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="60 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 70"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>70</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="125"><mstyle><mrow><mn>125</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="70 is less than or equal to x, which is less than 80"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>70</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="135"><mstyle><mrow><mn>135</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The manager of a vacation resort believes that the ages of adult visitors to the resort can be modeled by a normal distribution. The manager surveyed a random sample of <math alttext="765"><mstyle><mrow><mn>765</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> visitors and recorded their age. A summary of the responses is shown in the frequency table, where <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the age of the visitor.

(a) Construct a histogram of the distribution of ages.
(b) Write a few sentences to describe the distribution of ages of the adult visitors to the resort.
(c) Does the histogram provide convincing evidence that the surveyed ages come from a normal distribution? Explain your answer.

topic.text: 1.5: Representing a Quantitative Variable with Graphs

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
